intro: Atraphaxis manshurica, commonly known as the Korean sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are typically fleshy and covered in a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Atraphaxis manshurica is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
